website_summaries.verdict: Unique, innovative design works quite well, but be wary of rough terrain.
pros: Unique design provides stability while training for the weight balance of a two-wheeler
Folds for easy carrying and storage
cons: Not suitable for rougher terrain due to tiny wheels, and that means it can't go places other tricycles can

customer_reviews.title: Great pre-tricycle option
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old's birthday to ride around inside the house in the upcoming winter months, so I am pleased with the following: rubber wheels, so as not to scratch the hardwood floors; there aren't pedals to reach; he can go as fast as he wants to since it's self-propelled and it's compact to take over to grandma's house. So far, we're still in the stage of moving backwards, but not forwards yet, which glides really nicely. Hopefully, we'll be advanced enough soon to really test it out. And since it holds up to 44 pounds, we have time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Daley

customer_reviews.title: Love this little bike!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these in the last 2 years. They are perfect for toddlers! They can ride them inside without marring floors or furniture and outside. This bike folds easily, is light weight, and can go in the car when you travel. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So the bike is great..
customer_reviews.text: So the bike is great....if you're under 2. I wish the legs were adjustable. Its a great shape and a great size but too short. My daughter just turned two a week ago. She's average to small for her age. She was super excited about it but its a little short for her. Her feet keep getting caught underneath. But she's determined to ride it. Like I said before, I wish it was adjustable in height.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again if I had to
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves it. It's so convenient for both of us because it folds. We both can carry it everywhere. It's been proven sturdy enough to go up and down out the hill of our driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Mireya B.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient toddler bike
customer_reviews.text: My almost-3-year-old son is in love with this bike. He enjoys it most for indoor use as we live in a hilly area and this bike doesn't ride too well uphill. Would highly recommend for outdoor use on flat areas. What I like best is that it folds up which makes it so convenient for easy storage and travel.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam L.

customer_reviews.title: Safe, Compact, & 5 Years Of Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought Xmas 2014 for my 2.5 year old. Perfect little trike for him! When he outgrew it, it was passed down to his little brother. Got it out of the garage one day Spring 2019 and it finally broke. Since he had outgrown it as well, no matter. Little Brother was almost 4 years old when he was too big for it. In my book, 5 years & 2 kids is a solid run for a kid’s trike. Never had any issues with it up until the day it died.
customer_reviews.author: chickadees

customer_reviews.title: It has a smooth ride and is easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: My son has had this bike for almost a year (since he was 2) now that he is almost 3 he is just starting to grow out of it but doesn't seem to mind. My 4 year old loves to ride on this as well. It has a smooth ride and is easy to maneuver. I just wish it had something on it to help a parent push as it is pretty close to the ground. I have looped a jump rope around the handles to allow me to pull him around when he gets tired. This bike can tip but because it is lower to the ground my son is able to catch himself pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tiya

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome bike!
customer_reviews.text: My two year old LOVES this bike. I love that he can steer it and that he can go really fast on it. We have a few other little bikes like this and whenever a group of kiddos come over they all line up and fight over this one! It's really that much better than the others. I like it so much I've since bought one more for my home and two more as gifts. These seriously are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Present Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves this!!! He's on his second one--he got a little too rough with his first one--and I mean he ABUSED it--it wasn't the fault of the bike--he rides it everyday--it brings him so much joy--it was a birthday present for his first birthday, and now at 3 1/2, he still loves it. So now I ordered another one for my niece, who just turned one. It's a hit--get it!
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, stable, portable
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler LOVES his Fly Bike. From the moment we took it out of the box this was his favorite toy. The bike is sturdy, stable and portable. We love that it folds up making it easy to carry while minding a 20 month old. As with most items, our only complaint is regarding size. We have a very tall 20 month old and he has already outgrown many age appropriate items. We really wish that the seat height were adjustable. We already notice our boy holding his knees after 15-20 minutes of riding the bike.
customer_reviews.author: suep

customer_reviews.title: Great indoors for an active child!
customer_reviews.text: We've had ours about 2 years, and our 3 year old son still loves to zoom around the house with it-- a great way for him to get some energy out and be creative-- it's his "car" to work, his "fire truck" etc. Sturdy, easy to bring along on trips... Just wish there were a bigger version as he will out grow it soon!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Woods

customer_reviews.title: Super Cute!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandparents got my 2 year old son this and he rides it everyone around their house. He likes it so much that I ended up buying one for my house also. He goes everywhere on this little bike. It is very easy for a toddler to ride. Even his 7 year old sisters ride it around every now and again.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than specifications state!!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically purchased this bike because the product description said it was larger than my previous Fly Bike. It was supposed to be 18"x20"x13" when open. However, it was only 9.5 inches tall at the seat, the exact same size as my previous Fly Bike. The tallest point is 16.5 inches so either they sent the wrong bike or the product description is wrong. My 2 year old loves his Fly Bike. Guess I will have to try again..
customer_reviews.author: Greenslayer1

customer_reviews.title: Great first bike
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome for my granddaughter who is 14 month old. She can easily get on and off. Today was her first day with it and she doesn't quite have the idea of how to use her feet with it, but I am sure that will come soon. I love the fact that it folds down to make it easier to store. Definitely a hit in our household.
customer_reviews.author: Squirts Mom

customer_reviews.title: bike is too small
customer_reviews.text: Why I gave this tricycle 3 stars... Because my 20 month old son is to big for it! His feet are too long, he can ride it but his feet keep getting caught up in the back wheels. The overall bike is great, lightweight, the whole concept of folding it and unfolding when you need it is genius you can take it with you anywhere. However if your child is 34 inches or longer from head to toe than this purchase will be a waist of money. What they should have done is add an adjustable feature for the seat or legs than this bike would have been great. Description says good for 1-3 yrs old, no way.
customer_reviews.author: biba

customer_reviews.title: Amazing birthday gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to 2 year old birthday gift! My one year old son loves it too! We have bought several now for our friend's kids as well. We love how easy it is to fold and travel. I love that the wheels do not hurt my sensitive hardwood floors!
customer_reviews.author: JDarcy

customer_reviews.title: Solid and easy to fold up
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a second one for my twins, who at 16 months are starting to use it more, and fighting over it. We started at about 1 year for balance but had to hold them on it and push them around and for the most part they just went backwards. Now they have the hang of it and want to use it more properly. Also test drove it at the park with a bigger boy, maybe towards the 50-60lb suggested limit and it rode fine and he seemed to enjoy it, I think he was about 8 or 9, so hope to get a few years usage out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it and Easiest setup
customer_reviews.text: Best kids toy ever!!! No set up. It is put together you just fold legs open and you are done. If you go somewhere, putting this back to a flat position is just as easy. I bought this for my one year old nephew. Within a day all of my nephews from one to four were in love. It is fun glides easily and just a simple you for the busy moms who don't have time to unscrew and cut parts to put together. I thing this is perfect for kids under five!
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Made a perfect gift for a 2 year old kid
customer_reviews.text: Cute little scoot bike. Made a perfect gift for a 2 year old kid. She loved it! Looks like the price for this item fluctuates quite a bit, but thirty three was our number, which I think was reasonable. It is small, so might not be great for taller kids, and seems like a good precursor to the balance bikes.
customer_reviews.author: D. F

customer_reviews.title: A great first set of wheels
customer_reviews.text: This was a surprise gift for my 2 year old great granddaughter. She LOVES it. When the package was opened and the tryke set up, she got on it immediately. I love the fact that this can be used in the house as well as outside. Eva has a 1 year old sister who is next in line for the tryke. I imagine that I will have to buy a second because Eva will be using this for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Ward

customer_reviews.title: Nice toddler bike
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 13 month old. She can get on and off by herself. She's not walking extremely consistently, and we joke that she looks like Dr. Nefario cruising around the house on her little bike. It's good quality and keeps her happy. I was a little concerned the yellow wheels would end up looking grubby, but it hasn't been an issue so far, even being used outside from time to time. I can't see it being big enough for a 4 year old, but it's perfect for toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley I

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST little ride-on toy I've ever seen!! I have 2 daughters and now have 3 grandchildren, so I have purchased quite a few! THIS is by far the cutest and best! Our 'almost 2' year old grand-daughter loves it. She got on it right away and knew 'what to do'! It is great for indoors during a cold winter, and I'm sure she'll use it outside this summer. It came all in one piece, no assembly required, (which my husband and her dad LOVED!) and it FOLDS easily for storage or taking it from our house to hers. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Janana

customer_reviews.title: Well made and foldable
customer_reviews.text: We have recently downsized to a loft and wanted a riding toy for our GRANDchildren. This is an adorable, sturdy and best of all foldable riding toy. It is quite small. It fits our 1+ year old well. I think it will be ok for another few years. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice one, but was too small for my 2 yr old
customer_reviews.text: Nice one, but was too small for my 2 yr old. I wish there was a way to increase the height and he would have liked it more. 5 minutes out of the box and he would never want to play with it just because it seemed smaller than his glide bike.. Unfortunately we had to return it back but love the way this is designed and how easy it is to fold and carry in a car.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and I love that it folds down flat
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and I love that it folds down flat. His 5-YO sister loves it too. I can't seem to get her off of it! It's perfect for my 1 year old grandson who is VERY active. He isn't walking yet so he doesn't quite grasp using his feet to make the scooter move, but it's coming withing he next few months! I know he will be flying around the house.
customer_reviews.author: barrymama

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING BUY FOR A TODDLER, rolls and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A HAVE TO HAVE FOR A 20 month old and above. my son loves it and was flying around the house and outside in no time, it's so compact and perfect, my son learn to use his foot really fast and love his fly bike, best purchase i've made for my son. Great roll on cement and hardwood flllooors!
customer_reviews.author: Malina k

customer_reviews.title: Solid Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, like other reviewers commented, the bike is smaller than you would expect for the toddler age bracket. My daughter just turned 2, and is 50 percentile in height and her knees are quite bent, but the bike itself is light and it doesn't seem to bother her. It's a great transition bike before pedals. She can pick it up easily and take it wherever she wants. The colors are also accurate to the image, and the bike leaves no marks on our cherry hardwoods. The bike also runs smoothly making the activity quiet for the adults.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I bought it for a very active 2 year old boy to help dull the pain of having busy boys indoors more than usual in the winter months. He loves it and zooms all over the house on it. It gets use from the 5 year old as well! The bike is super small (which is a plus, in my opinion), stores nicely and compactly, and the wheels don't scratch the floors as they are soft. It also maneuvers well. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for a 22 month old, but probably won't last long
customer_reviews.text: I first bought my 22 month old a Big Wheel, but he couldn't figure out the pedals and got frustrated. So I bought this Fly Bike as an alternative. He can go forward on this, which I like, but it's so low to the ground that it's difficult for him to move without a gentle incline. I like that it's easily portable and required no assembly. So a "good" purchase, but I think he will outgrow it VERY quickly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: Foldable & portable bike!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy to find this bike and read such great reviews. My son is 14 months old and he can get on and off of it by himself, but is still working up to scooting. I love that the bike is lightweight and folds! How genius! I needed to be able to transport the bike in the stroller because when I take my child out for a bike ride I don't want to carry a heavy stroller. My 3 year old even gets on it sometime. I do think it is more for age 1 to under 3, depending on the child. The bike is sturdy and not tippy.
customer_reviews.author: SEM

customer_reviews.title: safety issue to consider before buying
customer_reviews.text: Serious safety issue to consider before buying: the front wheel support folds inward with an upward pull and a push against the wheel. A child trying to get over a bump or curb will naturally pull up and if unsuccessful, the bump or curb can push against the wheel just as the child pulls up. This can cause the front wheel to fold inwards while the child is riding. That said, we only have had this happen a few times and still have really enjoyed this rider.
customer_reviews.author: Theresag_nyc

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy and super easy storage
customer_reviews.text: We love this bike in fact we love it so much we bought 2! My daughter has been using it over a year and plays with it every day. Because of its unique tires and design we can let her use it in the house and are able to fold it up when playtime is over for easy storage. It takes a minute to figure out the latching system but once you've got it down it can be collapsed or popped up in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bike for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift for my year old grandson so I really can't comment on whether or not he will like it. However, I love the fact that I didn't have to put anything together, it was easy to unfold the wheels and it glides smoothly across the rug and floor. It seems sturdy and doesn't mark up my hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Bev R

customer_reviews.title: Great Find
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike for early rider. I got this for my grandson so he could get the concept of a bike and steering until he's ready for a trike. Initially, it was a good push toy to chase the dog, but he's got the concept down now and it's nice for the house but also the park and he doesn't have spinning pedals hitting his little legs. It was shipped quickly and it's been a great find.
customer_reviews.author: M. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Fun for littte ones.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loved this bike for almost a year. The toes of whatever shoes she was wearing got trashed, so we limited "scooter shoe" options. By the time she turned 3.5 she was too big to use it anymore (although she tried!). She is an average size for her age.
customer_reviews.author: A Real Person

customer_reviews.title: TOO SHORT FOR A TWO YEAR OLD
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful this would work for my small two year old (25 months) who is too small for a tricycle. It did not. She's below average height and it's too short. She was frustrated and kept having to stand up and walk with it. This is more appropriate for one year old in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: T&L

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made since becoming a parent
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I've made since becoming a parent. The ONLY wish I had is that it was an inch or two taller. My toddler is very tall (85th percentile) has used since 20 months, and will probably use until she is 28 months. But, perhaps once she grows out of it, then she'll be ready for pedals. It collapses small enough to fit under stroller so can take it along for vacations and longer walks. My toddler flies on this thing! And strangers always comment on the speed and how much it is enjoyed (and ask where we got it). Just fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: ZZZZ

customer_reviews.title: My toddler son approves!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2 1/2 and is in the 90th percentile on his height. He occassionally hits his knees on the handlebars but he still loves the bike. He wanted to sleep with it. He cried and cried after an hour of riding it around the neighborhood because it was time for a bath and bed. He wanted to just keep riding. It's been a week since purchasing this bike and he loves it. I just folded the wheels up and put it his bag for Nana and Papa's house for the week, super convenient and light.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Good for 1-2 yr old
customer_reviews.text: It's fun for a small toddler (I think 1-2 is the right age range). But it could be better designed. The wheels don't roll all that well. It's fine, but requires more pushing than you'd imagine from rollerblade wheels. Also the handles end up being a little too close to the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Loved the take out of the box and ready to ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the take out of the box and ready to go feature! Full circle movement and non-scratch wheels. Possible things to consider are the fixed height and narrow handlebars. I wish the handlebars were wider to help with the natural positioning of the hands and not centered like typing on a keyboard. My granddaughter loved it from the moment it was in the box; no time for assembly with a busy gal!
customer_reviews.author: B. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Good choice, rain or shine
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for two brothers. One is a little over one year old and the other is a little over two years old. I haven't gotten feedback yet from their mom but I thought it would be a great rainy day toy because it can be used in the house as well as outside on a sunny day. Hopefully it is a win-win for everybody in the family. I inspected it before wrapping and giving it to them for Christmas and it is well made, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Drc

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my little one when he turned two; would have been better when he was one. Its really small and kind of flimsy. He loves it anyway, but not any more than any of the other little riding toys we have. I was hoping it would give him some experience learning to steer, but the angle of the post makes the steering somewhat challenging. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Annadale

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this glider bike for my 2-year-old granddaughter who is very active. She loves it and uses it to travel all through our house when she visits. We have not used it outside yet, but I'm sure it will work equally well there.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting at all! My 2 year old was too big for it. The pictures make it look like it's taller than it is. It needs to be about 6 inches taller to work. It was not worth the purchase and will be yard sale material.
customer_reviews.author: Carlee

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great.
customer_reviews.text: Kid seems to know what to do as soon as I put her on it. Easy to use... Not the best in quality - one of the wheels had a little dent on the side, it was a bit dirty, the sticker on the front had like oil stains or something on all four edges of it (it could have been that I got a returned item) but looks and feel sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: mchicago

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little tricycle
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest little bike that my grandson will love. His mother will love it, too, because she can fold it up and take it in the car when they go to a place where he can ride his bike. It's a perfect size. I haven't given it to him yet, but I know he will hop right on and give it a ride. Since it is not as heavy as other tricycles, he will be able to get out of difficult spots himself and not have to cry for help. An excellent toy to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Perkins

customer_reviews.title: My almost 2 year old son isn't interested much in ...
customer_reviews.text: My almost 2 year old son isn't interested much in it. He'd rather use his ride-on bus he had from when he was younger. Update to my original review. My son is 2 1/2 now & he does love this bike. His feet don't reach the pedals of his tricycle or big wheel that we got him yet so he rides on this alot now when he wants to ride (in his words lol) super fast. He does get alot of use out of it now. I'm glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: My 19mo old son loves it.
customer_reviews.text: This bike is cute and pretty tiny. There is no way a bigger kid could ride this bike comfortably. We bought this as a trainer to teach him how to steer and to prepare him for his stride bike. It will do the job. He has been on it since it arrived. It is his preferred way to get around our house now. I think it seems slow and boring but he really likes it. On the road it does not roll very well but on our hardwood floor it is better.
customer_reviews.author: Heather K

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This little scooter is exactly what I was hoping for. I wanted something my 21 month old could cruise around the house on our wood floors. She can easily push it over rugs and turn it around when nessasary. For the price it's perfect. The wheels are a hard plastic and would get scratched up, so we probably won't use it outside.
customer_reviews.author: LuvBots

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike, but very short
customer_reviews.text: My almost 3 & 1 1/2year old love this bike! My only complaint is that it's too short for the both of them. My older son still manages but I wish it was height adjustable. Love how compact it stores and the style of the bike is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Roselli

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but small
customer_reviews.text: Item is sturdy and easy to fold. The box states that it is good for ages 1-4. It's perfect for my 1 1/2 yr old (who is small for his age) but no way on earth for my 4 year old. I imagine even a 2 1/2 year old would be too big for this. It's a decent buy. A little high priced for what it is, but well built and I'll get at least a few months of good use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike for Young Kids
customer_reviews.text: These bikes are great for 1 - 2 year old kids. My son is now 4 and has outgrown this bike but my 2 year old daughter loves it. It would be better if it were adjustable for an older kid, but for 1 - 2 year old kids it is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: JoeMcG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first bike for 18 monts to 2.5 yrs
customer_reviews.text: So pleased with this! My granddaughter is a very petite 24 months and we got this for her birthday. Perfect fit, and she jumped on and took off right away. This helps her steer, which has been an issue with other vehicles. It's foldable for storage, which is importand for this family's small home. The wheels are strong but don't tear up floors--I couldn't behappier!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: What a great bike! Gave this to our granddaughter for her 2nd birthday and it was the first thing she wanted to play with! Loved it !
customer_reviews.author: Mary B. Steinsdoerfer

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea, not ergonomic.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 1.5 year old nephew. Perfect size I would say. Only problem is, the rear wheels get in the way of his feet. So he can only take 6 inch strides to push himself along, otherwise his feet run into the rear wheels. So it's faster and easier to walk than use this thing. Darn, should have gone with the balance bike. He really likes the idea of it, but once he gets on it, he realizes it looks more fun than it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: ToThePoint

customer_reviews.title: It is quiet and easy for little ones to get around
customer_reviews.text: This little bike was ready for action right out of the box. It is quiet and easy for little ones to get around. It folds up nicely and is easy to take along.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous, lightweight, and sturdy starter bike
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well made. The wheels are rubber, not plastic, so they will not scratch grooves into your wood floors. The seat groove in the back looks strange, but it's so the wheels can fold up for storage. Little feet can get caught in this groove when little people try to get on the bike, so be nearby the first few times before they can get the hang of it!
customer_reviews.author: Vivian L

customer_reviews.title: It will be fun to watch our little great granddaughters push off
customer_reviews.text: It will be fun to watch our little great granddaughters push off...hopefully these are not overwhelming for 18mo. Girls. They apprear to be well constructed and easy to fold.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaJudy

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase! A great starter trike for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: My kid LOOOOVES this thing. And I love it so much because it folds up to nothing, fits into the tiny basket of my umbrella stroller and is inexpensive! We get a lot of compliments and inquiries at the playground.
customer_reviews.author: Semolina Pilchard

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Nice little bike. Folds up easy to travel with. My 18 m old is having fun on it but the wheels are small so it goes slow, he gets stuck in sidewalk cracks, and it's small. He's going to out grow it fast. It's a good little scoot bike but I think he'll outgrow it before he's 2.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter bike!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this on Prime day for my 21 month old son and I can hardly pry him off. We have used it both inside and outside with no problems. It is super easy to fold and is also lightweight enough for my son to carry around since he wants to do everything himself. Note: It says the age range is up to 4 but I think over 3 it would just be too small.
customer_reviews.author: MSD2013

customer_reviews.title: Only concern is that it indicates it is good for kids up to 5 years old
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a two year old. He really loves it and plays on it all the time. Only concern is that it indicates it is good for kids up to 5 years old. A two year old is a perfect size. If he doesn't grow taller it will be great until he is 5, but, I hope he continues to grow. As he does - his legs will be too long to actually ride it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy-Leroy

customer_reviews.title: My son-in-law said it was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves the bike. My son-in-law said it was easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Totally great, we bought this for our 18 month old ...
customer_reviews.text: Totally great, we bought this for our 18 month old son that is not quite ready for the balance bike. He loves riding this around in the house. It folded up nicely for holiday travel where it was tested by some older cousins on different flooring. All the kids seemed to really enjoy it and it held up well to the abuse. Very pleased and have recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Apkills

customer_reviews.title: BEST RIDE ON TOY THAT WE OWN!!
